SimEntity.author: pjsulliv
SimEntity.name: MilitaryPatrolCraft
SimEntity.Comment: A military patrol craft. This implementation is a basic patrolling pattern where a patrol craft will investigate unknown contacts and interdict perceived threats. This graph does not incorporate a complex set of Rules of Engagement, but rather simply patrols an area and attempts to identify all unknown contacts. The act of interdiction is accomplished by trying to block the contact with this craft. The overall implementation is based on a US Navy ship's Rigid Hull Inflatable Boat(RHIB) whose primary purpose is to defend a small area and primarily the ships that depend on it's patrol as an extension of the ships self defense posture

Parameter.name: entityDefinition
Parameter.Comment: The Savage Modeling Analysis Language(SMAL) object that contains all specific information about the model being used

Parameter.name: zones
Parameter.Comment: General areas from which waypoints should be generated for this entity.

StateVariable.name: visualRange
StateVariable.Comment: The visual range of a human on this platform

StateVariable.name: avoidanceRange
StateVariable.Comment: Contact proximity tolerance for this entity, used for collision avoidance

StateVariable.name: visualPerception
StateVariable.Comment: The visual perception of a human on this platform

StateVariable.name: collisionDetection
StateVariable.Comment: A collision avoidance sensor for this platform

StateVariable.name: activeMoverManager
StateVariable.Comment: The mover manager that is currently being used. Primarily used for swapping between mover manager types

StateVariable.name: zoneMoverManager
StateVariable.Comment: [Primary] mover manager used to transit in designated areas defined by the 'zones' parameter

StateVariable.name: avoidanceMoverManager
StateVariable.Comment: [Secondary] Mover Manager used for avoidance movement

StateVariable.name: interceptMoverManager
StateVariable.Comment: [Not used] Mover Manager that executes an interception

StateVariable.name: pathMoverManager
StateVariable.Comment: [Not used] Mover Manager that moves in a predetermined path

StateVariable.name: waypointCreator
StateVariable.Comment: [Mode - Probability] generates waypoints based on 'zones' parameter

StateVariable.name: tacticalMode
StateVariable.Comment: Tactical Mode of this entity

StateVariable.name: obstacleQueue
StateVariable.Comment: Collection of obstacles for this entity to negotiate

StateVariable.name: speedScale
StateVariable.Comment: A scalar variable which is applied to the speed of this entity. Variation in the speed scale is set for all entities by the diskit.ScenarioManager. This allows for simulation wide speed up /slow down functionality

StateVariable.name: nauticalChart
StateVariable.Comment: The nautical chart object received from the scenario manager

StateVariable.name: targetQueue
StateVariable.Comment: Stores and sorts targets based on proximity

StateVariable.name: contactPicture
StateVariable.Comment: List of all contacts in this entities contact picture

StateVariable.name: successfulIntercepts
StateVariable.Comment: [DATA] Total number of successful intercepts

StateVariable.name: unsuccessfulIntercepts
StateVariable.Comment: [DATA] Total number of successful intercepts

StateVariable.name: speed
StateVariable.Comment: [DATA] Used to collect speed statistics for this entity

StateVariable.name: contactIDs
StateVariable.Comment: [DATA] Total number of contacts ID'd

StateVariable.name: distanceFromMissedAttacker
StateVariable.Comment: [DATA] Distance from attacker at time of successful attack

Event.name: Run
Event.Comment: The run event sets the parameter values for each simulation run

Schedule.Comment: If zones have been specified, schedule movement setup events

Event.name: Init
Event.Comment: An initialization event that is scheduled by diskit.SMALMover3D to initialize it's subclasses. The event creates sensor objects and registers this mover and it's sensors with the diskit.ScenarioManager.

Argument.name: entity
Argument.Comment: The entity that is being initialized, passed as an argument from diskit.SMALMover3D

Schedule.Comment: Only register the visualSensor if this entity is not moving
If this zone is moving register all sensors

Event.name: ApplySpeedScale
Event.Comment: This event is scheduled by the diskit.ScenarioManager. All entities that have this event in their graph will adjust their speed values by the speed scale which will be applied throughout the entire simulation. Scheduling of this event occurs as part of the 'doRegisterTarget' process in diskit.ScenarioManager.

Argument.name: speedScaleChange
Argument.Comment: The uniform speed scale change for this simulation

Event.name: RegisterTarget
Event.Comment: Registers this mover with the diskit.ScenarioManager

Argument.name: mover
Argument.Comment: This object should pass itself as an argument to this event as part of the registration process

Event.name: RegisterSensor
Event.Comment: If this entity is not moving (e.g. no probability zones) only the visual sensor is registered with this simulation

Argument.name: sensor
Argument.Comment: The visual sensor for this entity

Event.name: RegisterSensors
Event.Comment: Registers the complete sensor array if and only if this entity has at least one probability zone

Argument.name: sensors
Argument.Comment: The complete collection of sensors for this entity

Event.name: ProcessZones
Event.Comment: This event creates waypoint creator and mover manager objects with the zones that were included as a parameter to this graph. If no zones are specificed the movement process will not be scheduled.

Event.name: StartMoving
Event.Comment: Begins the movement of this entity. Continuous movement based on waypoints from the provided zones will continue until the mover manager is changed

LocalVariable.name: initialStartPosition
LocalVariable.Comment: An initial waypoint in one of the provided zones

LocalVariable.name: initialDestination
LocalVariable.Comment: An initial destination selected from one of the zones

Event.name: Detection
Event.Comment: A detection event from any sensor that this entity is listening to (e.g. registered with the simulation)

Argument.name: sensor
Argument.Comment: The sensor that detected another simEntity

LocalVariable.name: alreadyIDd
LocalVariable.Comment: Check to see if this contact is part of the entity's contact picture

LocalVariable.name: canIntercept
LocalVariable.Comment: Check to see if intercept is possible

LocalVariable.name: isFriendlyForce
LocalVariable.Comment: Check to see if this is a contact of like forces

LocalVariable.name: contactSpeed
LocalVariable.Comment: TODO: Remove this and add an obstacle check, buoys, barriers, etc, will have slow movement

Schedule.Comment: If the sensor that detected the mover is the collision detection sensor, process the mover as an obstacle
If this is the largest sensor, and I haven't IDd the contact, and I can intercept it I will

Event.name: AssessObstacle
Event.Comment: This event uses diskit.util.MovementCalculator to determine if this entity is going to collide with the obstacle

Argument.name: obstacle
Argument.Comment: The mover being evaluated as a potential obstacle

LocalVariable.name: obstacleToAvoid
LocalVariable.Comment: Method call to diskit.SMALMover3D that uses diskit.util.MovementCalculator to determine if there will be a collision

Schedule.Comment: If I am going to hit this obstacle, and its bigger then I am (give way vessel simulated) or it's not moving then avoid it

Event.name: AvoidObstacle
Event.Comment: If a collision will occur avoid the obstacle using the avoidance mover manager. The avoidance mover manager will perform the avoidance and then reset the activeMoverManager to its pre-avoidance value after completing the avoidance maneuver.

Argument.name: obstacle
Argument.Comment: The obstacle that must be avoided

LocalVariable.name: avoidancePoint
LocalVariable.Comment: Method call to diskit.SMALMover3D to get the exact avoidance point for this obstacle

Event.name: BuildSensorArray
Event.Comment: Combines all sensors in an array

LocalVariable.name: multipleSensors
LocalVariable.Comment: Initialized to the maximum number of sensors possible for this object

Event.name: NauticalChartReceived
Event.Comment: Recieves a copy of a Utilities.NauticalChart object from the Scenario Manager. When the NauticalChart registers with this simulation the scenario manager schedules a 'doNauticalChartRecieved' event for all movers registered with the simulation. Only those entities with this exact event will actually receive the nautical chart object. It will be ignored otherwise.

Argument.name: nauticalChart
Argument.Comment: An A* zone map that is used as a nautical chart

Event.name: Intercept
Event.Comment: Gets the intercept point and determines if intercept is possible based on speed of contact and maximum speed of this entity

LocalVariable.name: timeToIntercept
LocalVariable.Comment: Get the amount of time that it will take to intercept this contact
